alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 5:06PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Floyd and central Pike Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 506 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Coal Run Village, or near Pikeville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Pikeville and Varney around 510 PM EDT. Meta around 520 PM EDT. Zebulon around 525 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Raccoon, Chloe, Shelbiana, Garden Village, Fishtrap Lake, Phyllis, Kimper and Marrowbone. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
